NASA was interviewing professionals to be sent to Mars.
Only one could go and couldn‚Äôt return to Earth.
The first applicant, an engineer, was asked how much he wanted to be paid for going.
‚ÄúA million dollars,‚Äù he answered, ‚Äúbecause I want to donate it to M.I.T.‚Äù
The next applicant, a doctor, was asked the same question.
He asked for $2 million. ‚ÄúI want to give a million to my family,‚Äù he explained, ‚Äúand leave the other million for the advancement of medical research.‚Äù
The last applicant was a lawyer. When asked how much money he wanted, he whispered in the interviewer‚Äôs ear, ‚ÄúThree million dollars.‚Äù
‚ÄúWhy so much more than the others?‚Äù asked the interviewer.
The lawyer replied, ‚ÄúIf you give me $3 million, I‚Äôll give you $1 million, I‚Äôll keep $1 million, and we‚Äôll send the engineer to Mars.‚Äù
